natural solution: Let $b_n = \frac{1}{a_n}.$  Then $a_n = \frac{1}{b_n},$ so \[\frac{1}{b_n} = \frac{\frac{1}{b_{n - 1}}}{1 + \frac{1}{b_{n - 1}}} = \frac{1}{b_{n - 1} + 1},\]so $b_n = b_{n - 1} + 1.$  Since $b_0 = \frac{1}{6},$ it follows that $b_n = n + \frac{1}{6}$ for all $n.$  Hence, \[a_n = \frac{1}{n + \frac{1}{6}} = \frac{6}{6n + 1}.\]for all $n.$  It follows that $a_{100} = \boxed{\frac{6}{601}}.$
